p: Substantial gains in women and girls in eastern and southern Africa are offset by a growing gap in care provision between men and women in west Africa and worsening epidemics among drug users in eastern Europe and central Asia. Although HIV epidemics in the Middle East and north Africa account for a small proportion of the global HIV pandemic, if unchecked, this may not remain the case. Those countries and regions where stigma and discrimination remain worst are not coincidentally those with the worst records in the HIV response.
